oracle.apps.fnd.applcore.oaext.osn.publicutil.converter
Class OsnFieldValueConverter

java.lang.Object
  oracle.apps.fnd.applcore.oaext.osn.publicutil.converter.OsnFieldValueConverter
Direct Known Subclasses:
OsnAttributeLookupLovConverter, OsnAttributeLookupValueConverter, OsnBaseBooleanValueConverter, OsnBaseDateValueConverter, OsnBasePercentageValueConverter
public abstract class OsnFieldValueConverter
extends java.lang.Object

The base class for all OSN Integration Converters.

The run method is used to execute the conversion which will perform validations on the data passed in and then calls the convert method. Any converters must implement the convert method which is where the business logic for the conversion resides.

Any issue that causes the conversion not to occur should throw a OsnConversionException. If the parameter validation fails or any exception is thrown from the convert method these will be caught by the run method and not passed back out to the OSN Integration code. The subclass converter implementation can override what happens when an exception occurs by either returning null (Default) or the Initial Value. Typically null cannot be converted into any other value so the run method will shortcut the calling of convert if null is supplied as the initial value. However if a subclass converter can convert null then it will need to override the canConvertNull method and return true.

If a converter requires values from the conversion context then it should call validateContext to ensure that the values are present in the context.

Using a Converter in the OSN Integration framework. To consume a converter, add the following to the ViewAttribute node as a child of its Properties -> SchemaBasedProperties node.
<fnd:OSN_CONVERTER Value="<converter>"/>
Where the <converter> is one of the standard converters (BooleanConv, ZeroToOnePercentConv, LookupConv, LovConv) or the fully qualified class name of the converter.

If additional parameters are required for the converter then they can be supplied by adding the following to the ViewAttribute node as a child of its Properties -> SchemaBasedProperties node.
<fnd:OSN_CONVERTER_PARAM Value="<parameters>"/>
Where <parameters> are defined in the format param1Name=param1Value;param2Name=param2Value. The created converter will have the setParam1Name method called with the param1Value as the solitary parameter.

Method Detail

run

public java.lang.Object run(java.lang.Object initialValue,
                            OsnConversionContext context)
Run the conversion on the initialValue and return the converted value. It takes the values supplied and calls the internal convert method to execute the conversion. Any exceptions that occur during the conversion process will not be passed out of this method.

Parameters:
initialValue - the value to convert.
context - additional data that is useful during the conversion.
Returns:
the converted value.

convert

protected abstract java.lang.Object convert(java.lang.Object initialValue,
                                            OsnConversionContext context)
                                     throws OsnConversionException
The implementation of the conversion routine. If an issue occurs during the conversion meaning that the conversion cannot succeed then a OsnConversionException should be thrown.

Parameters:
initialValue - the value to convert.
context - additional data that is useful during the conversion.
Returns:
the converted value.
Throws:
OsnConversionException

getName

public abstract java.lang.String getName()
The name of the converter that can be used for diagnosis.

Returns:
the converter name.

uponExceptionReturn

protected OsnFieldValueConverter.OnExceptionReturn uponExceptionReturn()
Determine what the converter's run method is to return in the case that an exception is thrown from the convert method. The two possible values are:
  • Null - return null
  • InitialValue - return the value of the run methods initialValue parameter

Returns:
OnExceptionReturn.Null.

canConvertNull

protected boolean canConvertNull()
State whether the converter is able to convert a null value into another value. If not then the appropriate uponExceptionConvert value will be returned. Default value for this is false but classes that are able to do the null conversion should override this method and return true.

Returns:
false.

validateContext

protected final void validateContext(OsnConversionContext context)
                              throws OsnConversionException
Confirms that the values within the context have been populated otherwise an exception is thrown.

Parameters:
context - additional data that is useful during the conversion.
Throws:
OsnConversionException - thrown if one of the context values do not exist.
